intro: Erigeron peregrinus var. scaposus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are linear and often have a rough texture, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
